summary: Oregon's landmark bottle redemption law is under review due to concerns over its unintended social consequences, particularly related to drug use and homelessness.
Efforts to establish a ferry service in Portland are nearing collapse as advocates seek last-minute financial support to salvage the project.
The Portland Trail Blazers have been officially put up for sale by the estate of Paul G. Allen, stirring concerns among fans about a potential relocation of the franchise.
Next Adventure, a cherished outdoor gear retailer in Portland, will be closing all four of its locations later this year as its founders prepare for retirement.
Oregon brewers achieved remarkable success at the 2025 World Beer Cup, securing 35 medals and trailing only California in total medal count.
The Portland Cinco de Mayo Fiesta proceeded as planned amid safety concerns at other events, though the public naturalization ceremony was canceled due to budget cuts.
Misfits Bar and Lounge, an LGBTQ-friendly bar in Portland, announced plans to close permanently in May 2025.
A David Lynch–themed bar, along with 10 other notable restaurant and bar openings, have been announced in Portland for May 2025.
The Portland Bureau of Planning and Sustainability shared draft changes to the City's tree code and zoning code ahead of a Planning Commission hearing on June 10.
Portland's population has finally grown after the pandemic, indicating a recovery from the depths of its pandemic-related problems.
Portland Parks & Recreation announced a new summer program offering free outdoor movies across city parks.
TriMet will begin testing electric buses on Line 20 starting next week to cut emissions.
A new food hall has opened in Southeast Portland, featuring 12 local vendors and community space.
Portland’s City Council passed a resolution to improve bike lane safety in downtown corridors.
A popular NE Alberta Street coffee shop celebrates its 20th anniversary with community giveaways.
Heavy rain caused minor flooding in the Pearl District Thursday morning, city crews responded quickly.
Portland State University announces tuition freeze for 2025–26 academic year.
The annual Rose Festival parade will return June 1st with a new downtown route.
Multnomah County Library begins 24-hour return service pilot at five locations.
The Portland Bureau of Transportation unveils new traffic calming plan for East Portland neighborhoods.
